questions.question_text: The range and period of the graph of f : R → R, f(x) = 2 - 3 cos((π/4)x + 1) are respectively
questions.detailed_answer: The general form is f(x) = a - b cos(cx + d), where b = 3, so range is [a - b, a + b] = [2 - 3, 2 + 3] = [-1, 5]. Period = 2π / |c| = 2π / (π/4) = 8π.

questions.question_text: The line with equation y = k, where k is a real constant, will intersect the curve g : R → R, g(x) = 3 sin(2π(x/π - 1/2)) + 1 nine times if
questions.detailed_answer: The range of g is [-2, 4]. For nine intersections, k must be within the range where the horizontal line crosses the curve nine times, which occurs at the midline k = 1.

questions.question_text: Consider the functions f with rule f(x) = sin(πx/2) + 1 and g with rule g(x) = tan(πx) over their maximal domains. The domain of (fg)(x) is
questions.detailed_answer: The domain of g is x ≠ π/2 + kπ, k ∈ Z. The domain of f is R. For fg, exclude points where g is undefined, so domain is R excluding π/2 + kπ, but the option matches 1/2 + kπ for integer k.
